Class Song

  • java.lang.Object
    • Song

  • public class Song
extends java.lang.Object
    The Song class will be modeling a song in a playlist, which will contain multiple songs. A single song have a name, the song's artist name, the album that this song belongs to, and the duration of this song as an int in the units of seconds

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Song()
      Default constructor of the Song class, it is just used to created a Song object that have empty attributes so that the user can set it later after it is created using the mutator methods
      Song(java.lang.String givenName, java.lang.String givenArtist, java.lang.String givenAlbum, int givenLength)
      The parameterized constructor of the Song class in which the Song object is made with the given information

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getAlbum()
      Return the name of the album of the song that is released on
      java.lang.String getArtist()
      Return the name artist or the performer of the Song
      int getLength()
      Return the duration of the song in the unit of seconds
      java.lang.String getName()
      Return the name of the title of the Song
      void setAlbum(java.lang.String n)
      The mutator method for the Song's album name
      void setArtist(java.lang.String n)
      The mutator method for the Song's artist
      void setLength(int n)
      The mutator method for the Song's duration length, the given length to set the Song's duration to must be a valid length which must be greater than 0 seconds or else it will throw an InvalidLengthException
      void setName(java.lang.String n)
      The mutator method for the Song's name

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Song

        public Song()
        Default constructor of the Song class, it is just used to created a Song object that have empty attributes so that the user can set it later after it is created using the mutator methods

      • Song

        public Song(java.lang.String givenName,
            java.lang.String givenArtist,
            java.lang.String givenAlbum,
            int givenLength)
        The parameterized constructor of the Song class in which the Song object is made with the given information
        Parameters:
        givenName - The name of the song, this is also what the name of the wav file in the source file, so that it is less complicated if you want to play the song
        givenArtist - The name of the performer of the song
        givenAlbum - The album that this song is released on
        givenLength - The length of the song in the unit of seconds

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the name of the title of the Song
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the song

      • getArtist

        public java.lang.String getArtist()
        Return the name artist or the performer of the Song
        Returns:
        Returns the artist's name for the song

      • getAlbum

        public java.lang.String getAlbum()
        Return the name of the album of the song that is released on
        Returns:
        Returns the name of the album that the song is released on

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Return the duration of the song in the unit of seconds
        Returns:
        Returns a int that represent the duration of the song in the unit of seconds

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String n)
        The mutator method for the Song's name

        Postcondition: The name of the Song is set to n

        Parameters:
        n - The given name that you want to set the Song's name to

      • setArtist

        public void setArtist(java.lang.String n)
        The mutator method for the Song's artist

        Postcondition: The artist of the Song is set to n

        Parameters:
        n - The given artist name that you want to set the Song's artist name to

      • setAlbum

        public void setAlbum(java.lang.String n)
        The mutator method for the Song's album name

        Postcondition: The Song's album name is set to n

        Parameters:
        n - The given album name to set the Song's album name to

      • setLength

        public void setLength(int n)
               throws InvalidLengthException
        The mutator method for the Song's duration length, the given length to set the Song's duration to must be a valid length which must be greater than 0 seconds or else it will throw an InvalidLengthException
        Parameters:
        n - The given length to set the Song's length to
        Throws:
        InvalidLengthException - InvalidLengthException is thrown if the given length n is less than or equal to 0 to indicate that the given length is not a valid length to set the Song's length to
